name: CERT C Secure Coding Standard (2008) Chapter 9 - Memory Management (MEM)
summary: Weaknesses in this category are related to the rules and recommendations in the Memory Management (MEM) chapter of the CERT C Secure Coding Standard (2008).

author: Robert C. Seacord
references.title: The CERT C Secure Coding Standard

notes.text:
<xhtml:p>In the 2008 version of the CERT C Secure Coding standard, the following rules were mapped to the following CWE IDs:</xhtml:p>
               <xhtml:div style="margin-left:10px;">
                  <xhtml:ul>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-20 MEM10-C Define and use a pointer validation function</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-119 MEM09-C Do not assume memory allocation routines initialize memory</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-128 MEM07-C Ensure that the arguments to calloc(), when multiplied, can be represented as a size_t</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-131 MEM35-C Allocate sufficient memory for an object</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-190 MEM07-C Ensure that the arguments to calloc(), when multiplied, can be represented as a size_t</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-190 MEM35-C Allocate sufficient memory for an object</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-226 MEM03-C Clear sensitive information stored in reusable resources returned for reuse</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-244 MEM03-C Clear sensitive information stored in reusable resources returned for reuse</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-252 MEM32-C Detect and handle memory allocation errors</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-415 MEM00-C Allocate and free memory in the same module, at the same level of abstraction</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-415 MEM01-C Store a new value in pointers immediately after free()</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-415 MEM31-C Free dynamically allocated memory exactly once</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-416 MEM00-C Allocate and free memory in the same module, at the same level of abstraction</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-416 MEM01-C Store a new value in pointers immediately after free()</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-416 MEM30-C Do not access freed memory</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-476 MEM32-C Detect and handle memory allocation errors</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-528 MEM06-C Ensure that sensitive data is not written out to disk</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-590 MEM34-C Only free memory allocated dynamically</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-591 MEM06-C Ensure that sensitive data is not written out to disk</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-628 MEM08-C Use realloc() only to resize dynamically allocated arrays</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-665 MEM09-C Do not assume memory allocation routines initialize memory</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-687 MEM04-C Do not perform zero length allocations</xhtml:li>
                     <xhtml:li>CWE-754 MEM32-C Detect and handle memory allocation errors</xhtml:li>
                  </xhtml:ul>
               </xhtml:div>
